get.description: Get information about the current token.

post.description: Search a list of highlights, notes, insights, channels and/or themes.

offset.description: An optional offset - will default to 0 if not provided.

limit.description: A limit of search item results (highlights, notes, insights, channels and/or themes), if not provided it will be defaulted to 50 with a maximum of 250 search items per request.

contains.description: Substring to search for within the target string

overlaps.description: Checks for any overlapping elements with the target array

contains.description: Substring to search for within the target string

notes.description: Filter results based on note's title, authors, content and created_at.

contains.description: Substring to search for within the target string
Substring to search for within the target string

tags.description: Filter results based on tag's title, description, highlight_count and created_at.

overlaps.description: Checks for any overlapping elements with the target array

contains.description: Substring to search for within the target string

overlaps.description: Checks for any overlapping elements with the target array

highlights.description: Filter results based on highlight's authors, created_at, id, text, note and tags.

overlaps.description: Checks for any overlapping elements with the target array

contains.description: Substring to search for within the target string

overlaps.description: Checks for any overlapping elements with the target array

insights.description: Filter results based on insight's authors, created_at, id, published, published_at, title and contributors.

contains.description: Substring to search for within the target string

overlaps.description: Checks for any overlapping elements with the target array

channels.description: Filter results based on channel's authors, created_at, and title.

contains.description: Substring to search for within the target string

themes.description: Filter results based on theme's created_at, title/summary.

filter.description: An optional filter for search. Please provide an empty array if you want to include other objects.

query.description: An optional query to search the highlights, notes, insights, channels and/or themes.

post.description: Summarize a list of highlights, notes, insights, themes, and/or tags.

highlight_ids.description: A list of unique highlightIds that you wish to summarize.

note_ids.description: A list of unique noteIds that you wish to summarize.

insight_ids.description: A list of unique insightIds that you wish to summarize.

theme_ids.description: A list of unique themeIds that you wish to summarize.

tag_ids.description: A list of unique tagIds that you wish to summarize.

with_citations.description: An optional flag whether to show citations or not, true by default.

post.description:
Create a channel with title in a specified folder.

Returns the channel object.

content_type.description: The channel's content type. Possible values: [APP_REVIEW, CHURN_REASONS, NPS_FEEDBACK, PRODUCT_REVIEW, SUPPORT_TICKETS]

project_category_id.description: Unique identifier of the folder you want to save this channel.

patch.description:
Update a channel.

Returns the updated channel object.

> 🚧 Permissions
>
> Please check you have the relevant permissions required to access this resource. This may include specific permissions on the object itself or its parent, or having the correct user role if you're making updates.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the channel.

context.description: The channel's context, used to set the channel's main goal or purpose.
context.example: Understanding customer feedback and improving product features

delete.description:
Delete a channel.

Deleted channel end up in your specific project's trash, but can be restored for up to 30 days before they’re automatically and permanently deleted.

Returns the deleted channel object.

> 🚧 Permissions
>
> Please check you have the relevant permissions required to access this resource. This may include specific permissions on the object itself or its parent, or having the correct user role if you're making updates.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the channel.

post.description:
Create a topic with title and description in a specified channel.

Returns the topic object.

patch.description:
Update a topic.

Returns the updated topic object.

> 🚧 Permissions
>
> Please check you have the relevant permissions required to access this resource. This may include specific permissions on the object itself or its parent, or having the correct user role if you're making updates.

parameters.name: topic_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the topic.

delete.description:
Delete a topic.

Deleted topic end up in your specific project's trash, but can be restored for up to 30 days before they’re automatically and permanently deleted.

Returns the deleted topic object.

> 🚧 Permissions
>
> Please check you have the relevant permissions required to access this resource. This may include specific permissions on the object itself or its parent, or having the correct user role if you're making updates.

parameters.name: topic_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the topic.

post.description:
Create a data point in a channel with text, a timestamp, and optional metadata.

Returns the data point object without the content.

text.description: The data point's content, used to analyze and classify the data point.
text.example: Support email requesting a trial for Dovetail app.

channel_id.description: Unique identifier of the channel that the data point is associated with.

timestamp.description: The data point's timestamp in ISO8601 format.

source_title.description: The title of the original source from which this data point was extracted.

source_url.description: The URL of the original source from which this data point was extracted.

metadata.description: Optional key-value metadata to be included with the data point.

get.description: Get a list of projects associated with a workspace.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: See [Pagination](https://developers.dovetail.com/docs/pagination) for details about how to use a cursor to iterate through the list.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: See [Filters](https://developers.dovetail.com/docs/filters) for details on parameter formatting.

contains.description: Substring (case-insensitive) to search for within the target string

title.description: Filter results based on string value. You can either provide a `contains` operator for substring matching or an `equal_to` operator for exact matching. These options are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: See [Sort](https://developers.dovetail.com/docs/sort) for details on the sort parameter.

get.description: Get a list of data associated with a workspace.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: See [Pagination](https://developers.dovetail.com/docs/pagination) for details about how to use a cursor to iterate through the list.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: See [Filters](https://developers.dovetail.com/docs/filters) for details on parameter formatting.

gte.description: Great than or equal to operator

created_at.description: Filter results based on dates. When passing in operators, the operator pairs are mutually exclusive. For example, you cannot send both `gt` and `gte` in the same request.

project_id.description: Unique identifier(s) of the associated project(s)

contains.description: Substring (case-insensitive) to search for within the target string

title.description: Filter results based on string value. You can either provide a `contains` operator for substring matching or an `equal_to` operator for exact matching. These options are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: See [Sort](https://developers.dovetail.com/docs/sort) for details on the sort parameter.

post.description:
Create a data in the dovetail project with a text content, title and/or fields.

Returns the data object without the content.

> 🚧 Permissions
>
> Please check you have the relevant permissions required to access this resource. This may include specific permissions on the object itself or its parent, or having the correct user role if you're making updates.

content.description: The initial content of the data, which may include plain text or HTML content.
content.example: This is my new data that will talk about the key learnings of the interview.

project_id.description: Unique identifier of the project that the data is associated with.

get.description:
Get a data by id.

> 🚧 Permissions
>
> Please check you have the relevant permissions required to access this resource. This may include specific permissions on the object itself or its parent, or having the correct user role if you're making updates.

parameters.name: data_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the data.

patch.description:
Updates a data.

Returns the updated data object.

> 🚧 Permissions
>
> Please check you have the relevant permissions required to access this resource. This may include specific permissions on the object itself or its parent, or having the correct user role if you're making updates.

parameters.name: data_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the data.

delete.description:
Delete a data.

Deleted data end up in your specific project's trash, but can be restored for up to 30 days before they’re automatically and permanently deleted.

Returns the updated data object.

> 🚧 Permissions
>
> Please check you have the relevant permissions required to access this resource. This may include specific permissions on the object itself or its parent, or having the correct user role if you're making updates.

parameters.name: data_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the data.

get.description:
Export a data in HTML or Markdown format.

Returns the data object with the requested export content.

parameters.name: data_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the data.

post.description:
Import a public url of a file as a new data.

If it is a video or audio file, transcription will automatically be queued and run after upload.

Returns a new data object.

> 🚧 Permissions
>
> Please check you have the relevant permissions required to access this resource. This may include specific permissions on the object itself or its parent, or having the correct user role if you're making updates.


> 🚧 Supported URL's
>
> Only public urls which are linked to a direct download of a file are supported. If the url does not have a file extension, you must provide the `mime_type` parameter.

> 🚧 Fields
>
> Only existing and unique fields can be used. This endpoint will not create new fields, or attempt to differentiate between duplicate fields.

> 📘 Notification
>
> When a transcription is complete or fails, the account linked to the token will be send a notification. You can manage those notifications in the [notifications settings](https://dovetail.com/settings/user/notifications).

mime_type.description: The nature and format of file want to import.

project_id.description: Unique identifier of the project that the data is associated with.

url.description: Public url to the file that you want to import.

created_at.description: The creation date and time to associate with the file, in ISO 8601 format.

author_id.description: Unique identifier of the Dovetail user that the file is associated with.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the file.

created_at.description: Filter results based on dates. When passing in operators, the operator pairs are mutually exclusive. For example, you cannot send both `gt` and `gte` in the same request.
